H0.text: Biodiversity is the term used to describe the variety of life and its processes, including the variety of living organisms, the genetic differences among them, and the communities and ecosystems in which they occur.

H1.text: Biosphere is the term that describes the variety of life and its processes, including the variety of living organisms, the genetic differences among them, and the communities and ecosystems in which they occur.

H2.text: Habitat is the term used to describe the variety of life and its processes, including the variety of living organisms, the genetic differences among them, and the communities and ecosystems in which they occur.

H3.text: Evolution is the term used to describe the variety of life and its processes, including the variety of living organisms, the genetic differences among them, and the communities and ecosystems in which they occur.

A4.text: Biodiversity is the variability of life on Earth.

A5.text: Biodiversity is not distributed evenly on Earthâ€”it is greater in the tropics as a result of the warm climate and high primary productivity in the region near the equator.
